name: Hampton Inn & Suites by Hilton Windsor

reviews.title: Don't get taken on the Rates
reviews.text: We made reservations in advance for the new Hampton Inn in Windsor, Ontario, and were quoted a rate by the central reservation office and given a confirm number. Upon checkin on June 10, 2005, the Hampton refused to honour the quoted rate, saying they had no record of it, despite recognizing their confirm no. They basically said that I have to pay whatever the rate is they present at the desk that day (which was significantly higher than what I was quoted), and unless I had a written quote from their central res office there was nothing they would do, even if I was checking in late in the day.

reviews.title: You can hear everything !!!
reviews.text: We were very poorly treated and caution anyone going there to protect yourself by insisting on a fax or signed scan of their quote sent by email. There are very clean hotels directly across the street with very competitive rates should this happen to you.

Lovely on the oustide. Great breakfast as well. But you can hear every little sound in the adjacent rooms, including the bathroom (yuk) !! People talking at a normal tone just comes right through the walls and wakes you up at nite. I don't recommend if you want a quiet, peaceful sleep and any sense of dignity while in the bathroom !
reviews.title: Great Hotel
BRAND NEW!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn two nights for a hockey tournament. We got the suite with a king bed and a sofa that turned into a bed. Our room also had a desk, mini refrigerator, microwave and small sink. We got to enjoy the indoor swimming pool and deluxe breakfast. We had a wonderful stay there. This was our second year and we plan on going back next year.

I had two rooms booked at this hotel. Nice size rooms, comfortable beds, and very clean. In the evening they have milk and cookies for kids and great breakfast cold buffet in the morning. Easy and close to downtown Windsor. i stayed there for my lasik eye surgery and found it very comfortable, quiet and dark. The front staff was just okay- some minor mistakes, but no big deal.
reviews.title: Great Breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a better hotel than the Holiday Inn that is next door, With family and work- this is the place for comfort and efficiency. ooh, Pool is on the small side, warm, but overly chlorinated like most hotels.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: Great breakfast, good-sized room (we upgraded to a suite for extra $20), free parking, free internet, and very friendly staff. We usually stay at the Hilton in Windsor (big charge for parking and internet), but except for the location, the Hampton Inn has the Hilton beat.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Myself and 2 buddies stayed @ the Hampton Inn in Windsor for the Nascar race in Michigan. We had a nice time in Windsor, the Hampton Inn was clean and friendly. The check in & out was great. The guy @ the front desk called us a cab so we could go Downtown and have fun. Overall the place was great, and there is a Tim Horton's right across the street.
reviews.title: Quiet Hotel!!!

reviews.text: We read the reviews of this hotel and were very perturbed by the one that said it was noisy, in fact we nearly cancelled our booking. When we arrived I asked the staff to let us test the sound levels out, my husband went into one room and I went into the next one and we both shouted very loudly - didn't hear a sound. Whoever wrote that review must have had a personal spiteful reason to be so mendacious.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel
